intro: Viola japonica, commonly known as the Japanese violet, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and delicate, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers, which range in color from purple to white, bloom in early spring. Viola japonica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
